title: What types of database have you used and how was it used? Did the company benefit from the use of databases? - Quora

response.answer_text: MS-SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, SQLite, MS-Access, MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis, Foxpro. Not in that order and all to varying degrees. And some others. Every kind of project. Immunization records, Health care, Family Medical Leave Act, Manufacturing purchasing, Mfg invoices, Mfg Labor, Travel scheduling, Financial, Magazine subscriber, Help Desk systems, caching services, password services, Cable TV, Telephony, ISP, Coroner, Repeat Offender dbs, Real Estate, Foster care, City Tax dbs, Student tests and answers, Student records, Library systems, Payroll, Catalogs, and probably more I can’t think of. I’ve even had projects that were databases tracking other databases. Sometimes I built the dbs, sometimes I maintained someone else’s and sometimes my role was to build the SQL or Procedural SQL to extract information from them. Did the company benefit? Well, companies and government groups and so on in my case. Yes, very much so. To the point that when we would do Disaster Recovery Studies against various dbs the usual answer that came out was that losing a day of data changes would often cost the company enough money to shut the business down forever. In some cases the entire business couldn’t be accomplished without some kind of database system.
I’ve used: InformixMysqlGreater benefits have been achieved in Mysql, for being open sourced and providing, for the operational environment, the same functionality as any DBMS (cost-benefit ratio)

Databases used in production oraclemysql (many times)db2sql serverpostgresqlIn all cases, the companies products and / or services were built on databases. they are an integral part of every business today. Most applications you use are using databases
